verses.text: 禁食問題大利烏王第四年九月，就是基斯流月初四日，耶和華的話臨到撒迦利亞。

words.note: Lit. 'prohibit eating'
Used before numbers to form ordinals (e.g., first, second)
Name of a Hebrew month (ninth month of the civil year).
Indicates the early part or the first day of a lunar month.
The divine name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used for divine messages or events befalling someone.

verses.text: 那時，伯特利人差派了沙利色、利堅米勒和他的隨從，去懇求耶和華施恩。

words.note: Refers to the inhabitants of Bethel, a city in ancient Israel.
Often used for earnest requests or prayers.
Lit. 'bestow grace', a common biblical phrase.

verses.text: 他們詢問萬軍之耶和華殿裡的眾祭司，以及眾先知說：「我們還要在五月哭泣和禁食，像我們這許多年來所行的嗎？」

words.note: A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over all creation.
Specifically refers to the sacred temple.
Used to denote a plurality or collective.
Lit. 'one who manages sacrifices'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Suffix indicating time duration up to the present.
Forms a nominal phrase referring to the object or result of a verb.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華的話臨到我，說：
「你要告訴這地的人民和祭司說：『這七十年來，你們在五月和七月禁食哀哭，豈是真的為我禁食呢？

words.note: Indicates obligation or future intention.
Lit. 'sorrowful crying'.
Rhetorical question, implying a strong negative.

verses.text: 你們吃，你們喝，豈不是為你們自己吃，為你們自己喝嗎？

words.note: Used for rhetorical questions, implying the opposite.

verses.text: 這些話耶和華不是曾藉著從前的先知宣告了嗎？那時，耶路撒冷和四圍的城鎮都有人居住，很是興旺，南地和高地都有人居住。』」

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Often refers to the Negeb desert in the Bible.

verses.text: 被擄是因為悖逆 神耶和華的話又臨到撒迦利亞說：

words.note: Often refers to the Babylonian exile in biblical contexts.
Strong sense of defiant disobedience against authority, often spiritual.
Can be a common noun or a title for the true God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Old Testament prophet.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華曾這樣告訴你們的列祖說：『你們要執法公正，各人要以慈愛和憐憫待自己的兄弟。

words.note: A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over heavenly and earthly armies.
Often refers to the patriarchs (Abraham, Isaac, Jacob) in a biblical context.
A compound phrase meaning to enforce laws with fairness and righteousness.
Often translates Hebrew 'hesed', denoting covenant loyalty and steadfast love.
Often paired with '慈愛' to describe God's character.
Can refer to biological brothers or wider community members.

verses.text: 寡婦、孤兒、寄居的和貧窮人，你們都不可欺壓，也不可各自心裡圖謀惡事，陷害自己的兄弟。』

words.note: A vulnerable group often protected by law in the Old Testament.
Another vulnerable group, like widows, under divine protection.
Foreigners living among Israelites, often without family or land.
Another vulnerable group requiring protection and care.
'不可' (bùkě) means 'must not' or 'should not'.
A strong verb for unjust treatment.
'不可' (bùkě) means 'must not' or 'should not'.
To scheme or contrive wicked things.
Can refer to biological brothers or wider community members.

verses.text: 但他們不肯聽從，反而硬著頸項，充耳不聞（「反而硬著頸項,充耳不聞」直譯是「轉着固執的肩膊，使自己的耳朵發沉不聽」）。

words.note: An idiom meaning to deliberately not listen.

verses.text: 他們使自己的心剛硬如金鋼石，不肯聽從律法和萬軍之耶和華藉著他的靈、透過從前的先知所說的話。因此，萬軍之耶和華非常忿怒。

words.note: Refers to extreme hardness, often translated as 'adamant' in biblical contexts.
A title for God, meaning 'Lord of the Armies' or 'Lord Almighty'.
A particle used to form a noun phrase from a verb.

verses.text: 我曾呼喚他們，他們不聽；照樣，將來他們呼求我，我也不聽。這是萬軍之耶和華說的。

words.note: Indicates a statement made by the preceding subject.

verses.text: 我用旋風把他們吹散到他們不認識的列國去，他們留下的地就荒涼了，以致無人來往經過，因為他們使這美好之地變為荒涼了。」

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating it is acted upon.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: A classical Chinese particle, similar to modern 'de' 的.
